cards.title: Prince William / I'd like to see more British football players in Premier League
cards.rawTitle: I'd like to see more British football players in Premier League

item.title: I'd like to see more home-grown talent come through British football, says Prince William
item.trailText: Speaking ahead of the FA Cup final between Arsenal and Aston Villa on Saturday Prince William says he'd like to see more British players make it to the Premier League
item.standFirst:
Speaking ahead of the FA Cup final between Arsenal and Aston Villa on Saturday Prince William says he'd like to see more British players make it to the Premier League. The Prince, who is a big Aston Villa fan, also theorises about which teams his children could grow up to support.

Watch the BBC's FA Cup final coverage on Saturday at 12:10pm on BBC1 to see the full interview

cards.title: Londoners lift bus to free trapped unicyclist
cards.rawTitle: Londoners lift bus to free trapped unicyclist

item.title: Londoners lift bus to free trapped unicyclist
item.trailText: Residents of north-east London work together to free a unicyclist trapped under the wheels of a bus
item.standFirst: Residents of north-east London work together to free a unicyclist trapped under the wheels of a bus. The 55-year-old man collided with the 212 bus on Thursday evening in Walthamstow. He is understood to be in a serious but stable condition in hospital

cards.title: The Guardian film show / San Andreas, The Goob, Timbuktu

item.title: The Guardian film show: San Andreas, The Goob, Timbuktu – video reviews
item.trailText: In this week's show, Xan Brooks is joined by Peter Bradshaw and Catherine Shoard to review the big releases
item.standFirst: In this week's show, Xan Brooks is joined by Peter Bradshaw and Catherine Shoard to review the big releases, including 3D disaster movie San Andreas, starring Dwayne (The Rock) Johnson as a helicopter pilot who must rescue his wife and daughter from a pulverising San Francisco, The Goob, a coming-of-age tale set in East Anglia from first-time director Guy Myhill and Timbuktu, Abderrahmane Sissako's controversial drama about jihadis in an African village. They also answer some of your questions, which you can post in the comments below
item.byline: Xan Brooks, Peter Bradshaw, Catherine Shoard, Joan Portillo, Caterina Monzani and Dan Susman

item.title: David Cameron's EU diplomatic offensive
item.trailText: David Cameron has been on a whistlestop tour of Europe this week, seeking out EU leaders in his attempts to clinch a ‘better deal’ ahead of the UK referendum
item.standFirst: David Cameron has been on a whistlestop tour of Europe this week, seeking out EU leaders in his attempts to clinch a ‘better deal’ ahead of the UK referendum

displayImages.caption: Cameron enjoys a laugh with the European commission president, Jean-Claude Juncker, upon arrival at the Eastern Partnership summit in Riga, Latvia last Friday. Cameron last year described Juncker’s appointment as a ‘serious mistake’ Photograph: Mindaugas Kulbis/AP
displayImages.altText: British Prime Minister David Cameron, left, is greeted by European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker during arrivals at the Eastern Partnership summit in Riga, on Friday, May 22, 2015.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Cameron enjoys a laugh with the European commission president, Jean-Claude Juncker, upon arrival at the Eastern Partnership summit in Riga, Latvia last Friday. Cameron last year described Juncker’s appointment as a ‘serious mistake’

displayImages.caption: Cameron looks concerned at the Eastern Partnership meeting Photograph: ZUMA/REX Shutterstock
displayImages.altText: British Prime Minister David Cameron Eastern Partnership meeting, Riga, Latvia
displayImages.cleanCaption: Cameron looks concerned at the Eastern Partnership meeting

displayImages.caption: Cameron hovers in the background as the Ukrainian president, Petro Poroshenko, glad-hands his Lithuanian counterpart, Dalia Grybauskaitė, in Riga Photograph: Alain Jocard/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: (L-R)- Lithuanian pPresident Dalia Grybauskaite, British prime minister David Cameron and Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko arrive for the second day of the fourth European Union (EU) eastern Partnership Summit in Riga, on May 22, 2015 as Latvia holds the rotating presidency of the EU Council.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Cameron hovers in the background as the Ukrainian president, Petro Poroshenko, glad-hands his Lithuanian counterpart, Dalia Grybauskaitė, in Riga

displayImages.caption: Juncker and Cameron together again at Chequers Photograph: WPA Pool/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker (L) speaks with Britain's Prime Minister David Cameron at Chequers, the Prime Minister's official country residence on May 25, 2015 near Ellesborough, England.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Juncker and Cameron together again at Chequers

displayImages.caption: The Dutch prime minister, Mark Rutte, admires Cameron’s footwork at his official residence in The Hague Photograph: Remko de Waal/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Netherlands' Prime Minister Mark Rutte (L) poses next to British Prime Minister David Cameron at his official residence in The Hague,
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Dutch prime minister, Mark Rutte, admires Cameron’s footwork at his official residence in The Hague

displayImages.caption: A jolly Rutte holds his hand out for the baton Photograph: Remko de Waal/EPA
displayImages.altText: Prime Minister of the Netherlands Mark Rutte (right) welcomes  British Prime Minister David Cameron to his official residence Catshuis in The Hague,
displayImages.cleanCaption: A jolly Rutte holds his hand out for the baton

cards.title: Anti-contouring: how beauty is moving back to basics
cards.rawTitle: Anti-contouring: how beauty is moving back to basics

item.title: Anti-contouring: how beauty is moving back to basics
item.trailText: The Kardashian contouring backlash starts here. Our makeup artist rounds up the best products to highlight and enhance, not disguise
item.standFirst: Kim Kardashian has made contouring the beauty buzzword of 2015, but beauty maestro Bobbi Brown has always championed the opposite: ‘Contour tells you what’s wrong with your face, and I’m telling people what’s right with their face.’ In short, that means luminous skin and highlighting – enhancing what you have, not camouflaging. Here are 10 products to accentuate your best features

displayImages.caption:
Bobbi Brown developed her entire brand around the principle of accentuating your best features, rather than trying to change your face, and many of us look far better with a bit more colour. This two-toned illuminating bronzing duo comes in four shades, so you can warm up your skin with the lighter shade in the winter and top up with the darker shade in the summer. The bronzer brush guarantees the most even coverage when custom-blending your glow.

Face and Body Bronzing Duo, £34, Bronzer Brush, £38, both selfridges.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Bobbi Brown developed her entire brand around the principle of accentuating your best features, rather than trying to change your face, and many of us look far better with a bit more colour. This two-toned illuminating bronzing duo comes in four shades, so you can warm up your skin with the lighter shade in the winter and top up with the darker shade in the summer. The bronzer brush guarantees the most even coverage when custom-blending your glow.

Face and Body Bronzing Duo, £34, Bronzer Brush, £38, both selfridges.com

displayImages.caption:
Radiant skin is essential to looking luminous, and it is easily achieved in the extra 15 seconds needed to mix two drops of this serum into your moisturiser or foundation. It is a small commitment considering the formula is super-charged with probiotics, peptides, antioxidants, omegas, vitamin E, jasmine, tuberose and a long list of 100% BioOrganic botanicals. No surprise this young British brand has such a cult following; it quickly diminishes dullness.

Probiotic Skincare Revitalise & Glow Serum, £47, aureliaskincare.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Radiant skin is essential to looking luminous, and it is easily achieved in the extra 15 seconds needed to mix two drops of this serum into your moisturiser or foundation. It is a small commitment considering the formula is super-charged with probiotics, peptides, antioxidants, omegas, vitamin E, jasmine, tuberose and a long list of 100% BioOrganic botanicals. No surprise this young British brand has such a cult following; it quickly diminishes dullness.

Probiotic Skincare Revitalise & Glow Serum, £47, aureliaskincare.com

displayImages.caption:
If you are after radiance and want to avoid drawing attention to fine lines and wrinkles, this subtle gem is the best. Not only is it spiked with green tea extract and vitamins C, E and F, it creates what is best described as a quietly luminous finish. Skin looks glowing and noticeably brighter without any visible iridescence or sparkle; the perfect stealth highlighter.

Skin Illuminator, £25, Cover FX, harveynichols.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
If you are after radiance and want to avoid drawing attention to fine lines and wrinkles, this subtle gem is the best. Not only is it spiked with green tea extract and vitamins C, E and F, it creates what is best described as a quietly luminous finish. Skin looks glowing and noticeably brighter without any visible iridescence or sparkle; the perfect stealth highlighter.

Skin Illuminator, £25, Cover FX, harveynichols.com

displayImages.caption:
If the mornings are always a rush and you want primer, moisturiser, bronzer, sunscreen and highlighter in less than one minute, then this is the tube for you. With an SPF 30, you can dash out the door without a moment’s thought as to whether or not you have put enough effort into your makeup for the day.

Dream Bronze BB Cream, £6.99, Maybelline, boots.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
If the mornings are always a rush and you want primer, moisturiser, bronzer, sunscreen and highlighter in less than one minute, then this is the tube for you. With an SPF 30, you can dash out the door without a moment’s thought as to whether or not you have put enough effort into your makeup for the day.

Dream Bronze BB Cream, £6.99, Maybelline, boots.com

displayImages.caption:
This four-colour palette comes in two shades. Caramel has nude highlighting and golden bronzing tones, while Rose has a pastel pink highlight and deeper pinky bronze tones. Wear each colour separately or swirl all together; either way you will add a shimmery, non-glittery sheen.

Shimmer Palette, £13.50, No.7, boots.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
This four-colour palette comes in two shades. Caramel has nude highlighting and golden bronzing tones, while Rose has a pastel pink highlight and deeper pinky bronze tones. Wear each colour separately or swirl all together; either way you will add a shimmery, non-glittery sheen.

Shimmer Palette, £13.50, No.7, boots.com

displayImages.caption:
Each of the four shades has a slightly different shimmery tone: Bare, Pink, Peach and Bronze. All can be used on their own or strategically padded on to cheekbones, brow bones, inner corners of the eyes and cupid’s bows to help light up and show off your best features.

SkinLights Illuminator, £11.99, Revlon Photoready, boots.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Each of the four shades has a slightly different shimmery tone: Bare, Pink, Peach and Bronze. All can be used on their own or strategically padded on to cheekbones, brow bones, inner corners of the eyes and cupid’s bows to help light up and show off your best features.

SkinLights Illuminator, £11.99, Revlon Photoready, boots.com

displayImages.caption:
This gel-powder is for seekers of translucent, sun-kissed skin who want to avoid powdery shimmers. The brand is synonymous with elegance, and the weightless, superfine formula delivers smoothing colour you can build on, fused with botanical skincare. It is the imperceptible, A-list way to a luminous bronzed glow.

Phyto Touche Illusion d’Ete, £66.50, sisley-paris.co.uk Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
This gel-powder is for seekers of translucent, sun-kissed skin who want to avoid powdery shimmers. The brand is synonymous with elegance, and the weightless, superfine formula delivers smoothing colour you can build on, fused with botanical skincare. It is the imperceptible, A-list way to a luminous bronzed glow.

Phyto Touche Illusion d’Ete, £66.50, sisley-paris.co.uk

displayImages.caption:
Fifteen minutes beneath these fluid soaked masks creates a noticeable boost, precisely the reason Pat McGrath enlisted them backstage at the Victoria Beckham autumn/winter 2015 show in NYC. McGrath said the masks were “an essential step in our beauty routine, as we needed to start with hydrated, healthy skin”. After the masks were peeled off, the excess liquid was massaged into the skin for a lasting lustre.

Facial Treatment Mask, £57 for a pack of six, SK-II, harrods.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Fifteen minutes beneath these fluid soaked masks creates a noticeable boost, precisely the reason Pat McGrath enlisted them backstage at the Victoria Beckham autumn/winter 2015 show in NYC. McGrath said the masks were “an essential step in our beauty routine, as we needed to start with hydrated, healthy skin”. After the masks were peeled off, the excess liquid was massaged into the skin for a lasting lustre.

Facial Treatment Mask, £57 for a pack of six, SK-II, harrods.com

displayImages.caption:
While preventing sun damage and age spots, this limited-edition cream has a water- and sweat-resistant formula that hydrates with green tea extract. The pearlised finish adds an instant glow, and playing the long game with a daily application of SPF50 is the smart way to keep your skin looking bright.

Face Protector Brightup SPF50, £40, SUQQU, selfridges.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
While preventing sun damage and age spots, this limited-edition cream has a water- and sweat-resistant formula that hydrates with green tea extract. The pearlised finish adds an instant glow, and playing the long game with a daily application of SPF50 is the smart way to keep your skin looking bright.

Face Protector Brightup SPF50, £40, SUQQU, selfridges.com

displayImages.caption:
This cream-based light reflector is non-glittery and gives you plenty of time to apply and blend. Packaged in a chubby twist-up stick, you can take your dewy finish on the move and build up a dazzling evening look.

Beauty Glow Stick, £10, Topshop Beauty, topshop.com Photograph: PR
displayImages.altText: anti contour
displayImages.cleanCaption:
This cream-based light reflector is non-glittery and gives you plenty of time to apply and blend. Packaged in a chubby twist-up stick, you can take your dewy finish on the move and build up a dazzling evening look.

Beauty Glow Stick, £10, Topshop Beauty, topshop.com

displayImages.caption:
This clever pen comes in several light-catching tones. Although it is designed to accentuate cheekbones and eyes, it is a charming solution for adding some brilliance on days when you crave a little boost.

Illuminating Highlight Pen, £40, tomford.com Photograph: PR

cards.title: Simon Pegg interview / 'Brits tend to be more emotionally repressed'
cards.rawTitle: 'Brits tend to be more emotionally repressed'

item.title: Simon Pegg: 'Brits tend to be more emotionally repressed' - video interview
item.trailText: The star of Man Up talk about the unfairly gender-focused reputation of the romantic comedy and why we shouldn't rely on alcohol to loosen up.
item.standFirst: Man Up stars Simon Pegg as a man who finds himself on an accidental blind date and Paul MacInnes sat down with him to talk about the unfairly gender-focused reputation of the romantic comedy and why we shouldn't rely on alcohol to loosen up. Man Up is now showing at UK cinemas.

cards.title: India heatwave / Roads melt as deadly temperatures continue
cards.rawTitle: Roads melt as deadly temperatures continue

item.title: India heatwave: roads melt as deadly temperatures continue
item.trailText: Roads disintegrate as temperatures rise to almost 48C (118.4F) in India's capital Delhi
item.standFirst: Roads disintegrate as temperatures rise to almost 48C (118.4F) in India's capital Delhi. Some 1,700 people have died in one week, as reports suggest the heatwave could continue for another 48 hours. Hospitals are struggling with the highest number of casualties the country has experienced in more than 20 years

displayImages.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Indiaroads Photograph: guardian.co.uk
displayImages.altText: 620x372 trailpic for Indiaroads
displayImages.cleanCaption: 620x372 trailpic for Indiaroads
